hat | house of buddleia 2 the freedom collection hat the freedom collection came to fruition purely as a way of using up all those scrappy bits of yarn that were abandoned in the bottom of my project bag freeing them from the shadows and turning them into something beautiful this pattern will instruct you on how to knit a simple but striking colourwork hat using all those leftover bits of dk yarn and as it s knit with yarn you already have stashed away it s essentially a free project 4g is enough yarn for one of the cc blocks in the adult size hats and approximately 3g is needed for each cc block in the children s sizes i used a rainbow of yarns for my original child sized sample and worked through them until i reached the given length for the adult m sample i chose a colour palette of greys teal and lime for a less scrappy version you could also try alternating your mc with just one cc so long as you have the correct yarn weights for the brim crown and the colourwork section you re good to go if you follow the pattern exactly you will work approximately 6 7 8 9 10 11 12 cc blocks in the colourwork section but don t let this restrict you so long as you have enough yarn you can knit this hat to a length of your preference please note that the colours and cc numbers on the chart are for illustration purposes only when
